entries.meaning: (fandom slang, of a ship) Having become canon by the end of the plot of a work of fiction or speculated to be intended to become such.
examples: TJLC’ers’ strong belief in Johnlock as endgame was intrinsically linked with their trust in the show’s creators, which enabled them to interpret the repeated denial of the subtext in Sherlock as part of the game.

entries.meaning: (chess) The final stage of a game of chess, when there are few pieces left. [1884]
(bridge) The final stage of a game of bridge, when there are few cards left.
examples: Bridge writing tends to concentrate on the end game.

entries.meaning: (by extension) The final stage of any game.
examples: Being stuck with two V tiles can make for an awkward Scrabble endgame.

entries.meaning: (figuratively) The final stage of an extended process or course of events, especially with the implication of the imminent realization of a masterful strategy or plan.
examples: What's her endgame, do you think?

entries.meaning: (video games) The gameplay available in a massively multiplayer online role-playing game for players who have completed all of the preset challenges.
